QuestionStem: Explore the image to learn how air pressure is modeled on weather maps.

content.imageAlt: In this map, patterns of air pressure and isobars are shown. You can click the hot spots to learn more about the relationship between isobars and air pressure.

panels.description: Each isobar traces along the same air pressure. The numbers show the measured air pressure in millibars (mb).
Where isobars are spaced far apart, the air pressure change is slight, so wind speed is lower.
Where isobars are spaced closely together, the air pressure change is great, so wind speed is higher.
